Articles.Content:
It seems like every rescue contract I see uses the wording "her." I haven't tried to rescue every single one, so maybe this is just a wording thing and some of them would turn out to be males? Or maybe it's just a weird coincidence?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T21:48:46Z" title="05/04/2015 09:48  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by KatzOhki**
I've rescued plenty of both genders, so I'd assume it's either confirmation bias or weird randomness.

OK cool. I don't mind having lots of females in my space program. Wish we had so many IRL.

Thought it was some sort of "lady driver" thing going on in KSP... ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Confirmed, I got my second scientist by rescuing and he was a he. Just sheer (un)luck I think . I use rescue contracts because I'd rather build a 50,000spacebuck rocket than pay the pittance it would take to just hire a new one from the complex .
Pittance? I have only 5 Kerbals and my next hire would be 90k+...
I've had rescue contracts for three females and four males so far.
